subject: Home & DIY
title: Graphene Could Revolutionize Home Materials
description: A quick win: understand Graphene Could Revolutionize Home Materials.

hook.text: Graphene is one atom thick, 200x stronger than steel, conducts heat better than diamond, and was found with tape.

buildup.text: In 2004, Andre Geim peeled graphite with tape until one atom remained. This carbon sheet has extraordinary properties.

discovery.text: Graphene concrete is 30% stronger, needing 50% less material. Graphene paint could heat walls or block EM waves.

twist.text: Mass production is the bottleneck. Lab graphene costs $100/gram. Home uses need it at pennies per kilogram.

climax.text: Companies now blend graphene into concrete, coatings, and insulationâ€”boosting performance without needing pure sheets.

punchline.text: One atom thick. Potentially world-changing. Still too expensive.

quiz.question: What is the main barrier to graphene's use in home construction materials?
options: Mass production costs are still far too high for practical use
Graphene is toxic when inhaled as dust particles
It degrades within a few years when exposed to moisture
